div.p: SOLECISM, in grammar, a false manner of ſpeaking, contrary to the rules or grammar, either in respect of declension, conjugation, or ſyntax.—The word is Greek, σολοιχισμϐ, derived from the Soli, a people of Attica, who being transplanted to Cilicia, lost the purity of their ancient tongue, and became ridiculous to the Athenians for the improprieties into which they fell.
